Articles.Content:
Have you ever wanted to just break some physics and watch stuff do stuff?

Then here i present to you, StarFruit!

Any questions? None? Good.

Download: http://bit.ly/1izGbcI

Someone's been inspired by basic consumer fireworks.

Umm, where's the fuel?

Someone's been inspired by basic consumer fireworks.

Umm, where's the fuel?

There is none! You will need to use Infinte Fuel, which is accessed by pushing ALT+F12 and using the debug console

Have you tried to use serpatrons instead of those liquid engines? Solid fuel burns much like a firework, and no debug magic!

I'll try this, when I unlock those parts.

"Not for weak computers" Part count: 4.

I bet that was a light joke

Also, you have a funny imaginary situation described in your signature. Which really happened, but to the soviet cosmonaut Leonov (the first man who left the ship in space and returned). When Leonov was ordered to get back into the ship - he got stuck, because of his suit, filled with air, like a baloon. Suit had stretched by the internal pressure while spacing, and Leonov had to wait the suit to stretch back enough. Yep, things are happening.
